body_html:
@guptapriya I test the fix using the master version of the git but still got an error. This time

RuntimeError: Tower-local variables may only be assigned in a tower context.

When should I call tf.train.init_from_checkpoint ?

Currently I call it inside the model_fn of the estimator.

My guess is that the synchronization is set on variable_scope.VariableSynchronization.ON_READ.
body_text:
@guptapriya I test the fix using the master version of the git but still got an error. This time
RuntimeError: Tower-local variables may only be assigned in a tower context.
When should I call tf.train.init_from_checkpoint ?
Currently I call it inside the model_fn of the estimator.
My guess is that the synchronization is set on variable_scope.VariableSynchronization.ON_READ.
body:
@guptapriya I test the fix using the master version of the git but still got an error. This time

```RuntimeError: Tower-local variables may only be assigned in a tower context.```

When should I call ```tf.train.init_from_checkpoint``` ?

Currently I call it inside the `model_fn` of the estimator. 

My guess is that the synchronization is set on `variable_scope.VariableSynchronization.ON_READ`.
